summary: This bill, the "SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Reauthorization Act of 2025," reauthorizes various programs addressing the opioid crisis. It covers prevention (e.g., prenatal health, overdose prevention, fetal alcohol spectrum disorder support), treatment (e.g., residential programs, addiction medicine access), and recovery (e.g., community building, peer support). It also includes provisions related to cybersecurity for the suicide prevention lifeline, the scheduling of buprenorphine/naloxone products, and workforce development. The bill amends existing legislation to update funding authorizations and make other clarifications and expansions of existing programs.
